thread.title: Trump launched Yemen raid after being told Obama wouldn't have
thread.title_full: Trump launched Yemen raid after being told Obama wouldn't have

author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: Trump launched Yemen raid after being told Obama wouldn't have
text:
Trump launched Yemen raid after being told Obama wouldn't have been 'bold enough,' report says Trump launched Yemen raid after being told Obama wouldn't have NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Tuesday, February 7, 2017, 7:24 PM 
President Trump was convinced to launch a “botched” counterterrorism raid in Yemen after being told that the Obama administration would not have, according to a report. 
Planning for the mission, which resulted in the death of Navy SEAL William Owens, stretched from last year, but was approved by Trump as his first major military operation. 
Defense Secretary James Mattis and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs Gen. Joseph Dunford told the President that capturing the raid’s intended target would be a “game changer,” an anonymous official told NBC News . 
Trump’s military advisers added that the previous leadership would not have been "bold enough" to launch it, the network said. Military advisers convinced President Trump to launch the Yemen raid with a comparison to Barack Obama, a report says. (Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images) 
Questions about the rationale for the operation, which reportedly killed civilians, wounded three Americans and resulted in the loss of a $75 million helicopter, come as the Defense Department denied that it was aimed at a high-ranking terrorist. 
Navy Capt. John Davis said Tuesday that there was “never any intention, hope, anticipation, or plan” that Al Qaeda leader Qassim al-Rimi would be captured or killed in the raid. 
Though his comments came as response to an NBC report saying al-Rimi was the “secret” target, tribal leaders told the Associated Press in the aftermath of the raid that the U.S. had been looking for him. The raid was reportedly targeting Al Qaeda terrorist Qassim al-Rimi, though the Pentagon has said it was not. (AFP/AFP/Getty Images) 
Al-Rimi, the leader of Al Qaeda in Yemen and one of the most dangerous terrorists in the world, was heard in audio over the weekend taunting Trump about the raid and calling him a fool. 
Yemeni brothers reunite with father after Trump travel ban 
White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said at Tuesday’s press briefing that the raid, which killed 14 Al Qaeda fighters, was aimed at intelligence gathering. 
Despite Spicer characterizing the operation as a success, the days since have seen unidentified officials say that the execution of it was botched. Navy SEAL William "Ryan" Owens was killed in the raid. (Department of Defense) 
A former SEAL Team 6 member told the New York Times that commandos knew the mission was compromised and that they “were screwed from the beginning.” 
In response to a question about whether al-Rimi had previously been a focus of the raid, a Defense Department spokeswoman told the Daily News that he was “never at any point” been a target in the operation. Tags:
